channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ukraine-Russia war escalates as Kremlin launches intercontinental ballistic missile for first time
item.description: While only two people were injured, the Russian attack signals the start of a new stage in the conflict as more advanced weapons are rolled out by bot...

item.title: Who’s Laughing Now? Banana-as-Art Sells for $6.2 Million at Sotheby’s
item.description: A conceptual artwork by Maurizio Cattelan, “Comedian,” is just a fruit-stand banana taped on the wall. But 7 bidders were biting. It went to a crypto ...

item.title: Donald Trump has a new line of branded gear: guitars that cost up to $10,000
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has endorsed a line of guitars, following up on the Bibles, sneakers, watches, photo books and cryptocurrency ventures la...

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: We explore his promise to impose a charge on foreign products entering the U.S.

item.title: Gaetz Ethics Report Blocked, and the Trial That’s Horrified France
item.description: Plus, a $6.2 million piece of fruit.

item.title: Israel Strikes Near Beirut as U.S. Envoy Pushes Ahead on Cease-Fire Talks
item.description: The envoy, Amos Hochstein, was in Israel and planned to meet with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, seeking a truce in the country’s war with the mil...

item.title: Should Olaf Scholz Step Aside in the New Race for German Chancellor?
item.description: Increasing numbers in his own center-left party say he should, arguing for a more charismatic leader who might better their electoral chances.

item.title: How Forced Labor and Hysterectomies Are Darkly Linked in India
item.description: Our correspondent explains how an exploitative labor system has produced a system of brutality in the country’s sugar fields.

item.title: ‘Wicked’ Review: Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande in Oz
item.description: Cynthia Erivo is the strongest draw in this splashy, overly long movie, which is the first installment in a two-part adaptation of the Broadway show.

item.title: Russia Gifts Bears and a Lion to North Korea
item.description: Vladimir Putin also presented a lion to Pyongyang Zoo, one of the more than 70 animals he sent as an emblem of the deepening friendship between the tw...

item.title: I worked with Steve Jobs. Here’s what he’d say about today’s leadership style
item.description: Many of today's leaders seem to have embraced the more dangerous traits of Steve Jobs without balancing them with his better qualities.

item.title: Bathing in Oil at a Climate Summit? It Leaves a Stain.
item.description: In Azerbaijan, site of the COP29 climate talks and a petrostate, people aren’t only proud of their oil. They swear by its health benefits and visit re...

item.title: Federal Reserve’s likely slowdown in rate cuts could make prospective homebuyers sad
item.description: Fewer rate cuts would likely mean continued high mortgage rates and other borrowing costs for consumers and businesses.
